notes: There were four rounds of reviews: 1st: 2 per paper (838); 2nd: ensure 2 good reviews per paper (308); 3rd: including appeals and external experts (303); 4th: (67). After the second round of reviewing, half the papers were rejected early. Starting next year (2018), the review process will transition to a continuous year-long evluation, like VLDB and PETS. See reasoning here: https://ieee-security.github.io/ongoing-submission-plan/. The disinguished reviewer award was given to Carmela Troncoso, Jacob R. Lorch, and Brad Karp. There is not rebuttal, but for early-rejection papers, there is an appeal process. Only 1--2 of those papers (9 appeals) was adjudicated, and none made it to the PC meeting or conference. This policy was considered a successful low-overhead alternative to rebuttals. There was an attempt to distinguish many submissions (> 3) from the same author, but the policy turned out to be controversial and annoying and will not be continued (http://www.ieee-security.org/TC/Reports/2017/SP2017-PCChairReport.pdf). Diversity: prioritizing funds for students from diverse backgrounds.
